Package linear_algebra

Class Operations

java.lang.Object
linear_algebra.Operations
public class Operations
extends java.lang.Object
Contains a list of matrix and vector operations as static methods. Matrices are addressed as array[row#][col#] starting at [0][0].

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static double CUTOFF
    The value below which a matrix value will be considered to be zero.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Operations()

  • Field Details

    • CUTOFF

      public static final double CUTOFF
      The value below which a matrix value will be considered to be zero.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Operations

      public Operations()

  • Method Details

    • invert

      public static double[][] invert​(double[][] A) throws SingularMatrixException
      Inverts matrix A using Gaussian elimination
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be inverted
      Returns:
      The inverse of A (multiply(invert(A),A) will return the identity matrix)
      Throws:
      SingularMatrixException - if a row contains values less than CUTOFF during the elimination, this error will be thrown

    • invertHermitian

      public static double[][] invertHermitian​(double[][] A)
      Inverts hermitian matrix A using Cholesky decomposition.
      Parameters:
      A - The hermitian matrix to be inverted
      Returns:
      The inverse of A (multiply(invert(A),A) will return the identity matrix)

    • identity

      public static double[][] identity​(int size)
      Returns an identity matrix of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the identity matrix to be created.
      Returns:
      An identity matrix of size size.

    • transpose

      public static double[][] transpose​(double[][] A)
      Transposes the matrix A (swaps the columns and rows).
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be transposed.
      Returns:
      The transposed matrix.

    • multiply

      public static double[][] multiply​(double[][] A, double[][] B)
      Multiplies matrices A*B.
      Parameters:
      A - The left matrix in the multiplication.
      B - The right matrix in the multiplication.
      Returns:
      The product matrix of the multiplication.

    • multiply

      public static double[] multiply​(double[][] A, double[] v)
      Multiplies A*v.
      Parameters:
      A - The left matrix of the multiplication.
      v - The right vector of the multiplication.
      Returns:
      The resulting vector of the multiplication of matrix A with vector v.

    • multiply

      public static double[][] multiply​(double[][] A, double s)
      Multiplies s*A.
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be multiplied.
      s - The scalar to be multiplied.
      Returns:
      The product of matrix A and scalar s.

    • multiply

      public static double[] multiply​(double[] v, double s)
      Multiplies s*v.
      Parameters:
      v - The vector to be multiplied.
      s - The scalar to be multiplied.
      Returns:
      The product of vector v and scalar s.

    • innerProduct

      public static double innerProduct​(double[] a, double[] b)
      Computes the inner or 'dot' product of vectors a and b.
      Parameters:
      a - One of the vectors in the inner product.
      b - One of the vectors in the inner product.
      Returns:
      The scalar result of the inner product of a and b.

    • outerProduct

      public static double[][] outerProduct​(double[] a, double[] b)
      Computes the outer product of vectors a and b.
      Parameters:
      a - One of the vectors in the inner product.
      b - One of the vectors in the inner product.
      Returns:
      The matrix result of the outer product of a and b.

    • trace

      public static double trace​(double[][] A)
      Computes the trace of matrix A.
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix whose diagonal components will be summed.
      Returns:
      the trace of matrix A.

    • add

      public static double[][] add​(double[][] A, double[][] B)
      Computes the sum of matrices A and B.
      Parameters:
      A - One of the matrices in the sum.
      B - One of the matrices in the sum.
      Returns:
      The matrix representing the sum A+B.

    • subtract

      public static double[][] subtract​(double[][] A, double[][] B)
      Computes the difference A-B.
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be subtracted from.
      B - The matrix by which A will be subtracted.
      Returns:
      the matrix representing the difference A-B.

    • determinant

      public static double determinant​(double[][] A)
      Computes the determinant of matrix A, |A|. This is achieved by multiplying A with its transpose and performing Cholesky decomposition to produce diagonal matrices to quickly compute the determinant.
      Parameters:
      A - the matrix from which the determinant is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      the determinant of matrix A.

    • determinantHermitian

      public static double determinantHermitian​(double[][] A)
      Computes the determinant of hermitian matrix A, |A|. This is achieved by performing Cholesky decomposition to produce diagonal matrices to quickly compute the determinant.
      Parameters:
      A - the hermitian matrix from which the determinant is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      the determinant of matrix A.

    • choleskyHermitian

      public static double[][] choleskyHermitian​(double[][] A)
      Computes the lower triangular matrix, L that Cholesky decomposes hermitian matrix A using the Choleskyâ€“Banachiewicz algorithm. A = multiply(L, transpose(L)).
      Parameters:
      A - The hermitian matrix to be decomposed.
      Returns:
      the lower triangular matrix, L that Cholesky decomposes hermitian matrix A.

    • l2norm_square

      public static double l2norm_square​(double[] v)
      Computes the square of the L2 norm of the vector v. This is achieved by adding the square of each vector component.
      Parameters:
      v - the vector whose squared L2 norm is to be computed.
      Returns:
      The square of the L2 norm of v.

    • printMatrix

      public static void printMatrix​(double[][] A)
      Prints the contents of matrix A to System.out.
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be printed.
